name: (3-nitrophenyl)[(5E)-4-phenyl-5-(phenylhydrazono)-4,5-dihydro-1,3,4-thiadiazol-2-yl]methanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1056
Reason:
3-Nitrophenyl group: The 3-nitro group can increase the melting point due to the presence of a nitro functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, raising it by approximately +10°C.
Phenyl group (2 phenyls): The two phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
Hydrazono group: The hydrazono group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which can raise the melting point by approximately +5°C.
Thiadiazole ring: The thiadiazole ring can form hydrogen bonds, which can increase the melting point by approximately +10°C.
Methylene bridge: The methylene bridge can form hydrogen bonds, which can raise the melting point by approximately +5°C.
